summary: This is a September 13, 2021 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, transmitting a batch of discovery materials. The letter details the Bates-stamped range of documents being produced, including FAA records, photographs, subpoena returns, birth certificates, and system information, and notes the materials are subject to a protective order.

events.title: Discovery Production to Maxwell Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces a large batch of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, including FAA records, photographs, subpoena returns, and birth certificates.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced discovery materials (Bates range SDNY_GM_02753699 through SDNY_GM_02762475) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team on September 13, 2021.

The production included FAA Certified Records, photographs, T-Mobile and Xavier College Preparatory subpoena returns, certified birth certificates for individuals identified as 'M.' and 'S.', and system information from computers.
The materials were subject to a specific protective order dated July 31, 2020, and were marked with a label referencing paragraphs 7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17 of that order.

The letter notes a recent DOJ directive to cease using the marking 'confidential' on discovery to avoid confusion with classified document markings, leading to the new 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER' label.
The document index reveals investigative focus on flight records (FAA), communications (T-Mobile), a school (Xavier College Preparatory), and specific properties ('Little St. John' and 'NY').
